author: Ria Kapoor
content: Instagram influencer Chandni Bhabhda spoke to News9live on Women's Day. In an empowering message to young females, she said, "Make your flaws your biggest strength." "Don't be afraid to explore different avenues and experiment with various types of content until you find what truly resonates with you. Remember that authenticity is key," she further said.
title: Make your flaws your strength: Chandni's message on Women's Day

author: Ria Kapoor
content: A temple in Madhya Pradesh's Guna was decorated in wedding style on the occasion of Mahashivratri. Pictures of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati were also displayed in pre-wedding shoot style at the entrance of the. A board with Shiva and Parvati written on it was also put up as part of the decorations for Mahashivratri on March 8.
title: MP temple displays Shiva-Parvati photos in pre-wedding shoot style

author: FPJ Online Edit
content: Jasprit Bumrah's impressive cover drive received a round of applause from India dressing on Day 2 of the 5th Test against England in Dharamshala. Bumrah walked out to bat India were 428/8 after Ashwin's dismissal. In the 118th over, Mark Wood bowled a full-length delivery and Jasprit Bumrah played a cover drive through gaps to gather four runs.
title: Video: Bumrah's cover drive receives applause from dressing room

author: Saumya Agrawal
content: A Google software engineer in Bengaluru shared glimpses of her work life in an Instagram reel. After checking her schedule, she went for breakfast. Apart from coding and attending meetings, she goes for workouts, plays games, reads, and enjoys jamming sessions. "Head to office and entry with card tak to mere office me bhi same hai," a user joked.
title: Food, gym, games: Google employee shares glimpses of office life

author: Saumya Agrawal
content: A rich housewife named Linda Andrade slammed her millionaire husband for not gifting her a mansion after giving birth. He bought her a handbag, a new car and a diamond from the luxury jewellery brand Cartier. "I'm a little annoyed though, because I asked for a mansion and he got me a condo," she said.
title: Millionaire's wife upset for not getting house after giving birth

author: Saumya Agrawal
content: Female priests at Shubhamastu are challenging stereotypes as they officiate weddings across India. Led by Dr Nandini, this Kolkata-based organisation conducts wedding rituals in Vedic style. The female priests dropped their surnames as people wanted to know if they are Brahmin. "You have to honour me for the quality of my priesthood, not my surname," Dr Nandini said.
title: Kolkata's female priests redefine Indian weddings

author: FPJ Online Edit
content: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav was left impressed with his Mumbai teammate Sarfaraz Khan's blistering half-century on Day 2 in the 5th Test against England in Dharamshala. Taking to his Instagram story, Suryakumar Yadav hailed Sarfaraz Khan after the youngster crossed the 50-run mark and wrote, "Sher Bhukha Hai (Tiger Is Hungry)."
title: Suryakumar calls Sarfaraz as 'Sher' after completing fifty

author: Saumya Agrawal
content: A Reddit user shared insights from his experience on a week-long 2,000-person nude cruise. "This cruise is very non-sexual," he said. After spending the day nude in the sun, some people might dress up in the night. He added, "If you're there for the views, you're probably going for the wrong reasons."
title: Man who went on 2,000-person nude cruise shares what it is like

author: The Hawk Editor
content: Bengaluru's Rameshwaram Cafe, hit by a blast on March 1, reopens with enhanced security. Owner thanks government for support; NIA leads probe, offering Rs 10 lakh for bomber info. CCTV upgrades and specialized staff aim to ensure safety as the cafe resumes welcoming guests, embodying resilience.
title: Rameshwaram cafe reopens, Bengaluru owner confirms safety measures

author: Bhana Neur
content: Do women automatically internalise that housework is their duty? When men try to do it, women feel guilty for ignoring their duties. Moreover, society has normalised the idea that men who work in the kitchen are not masculine enough. So women do not want their men to be shamed for helping their wives in the kitchen.
title: Do women really not want men in the kitchen?
